snippet: Brown, who led the Knicks to a 23-59 record in 2005-6, said, among other things, that his former employer was treating the current coach, Mike Woodson, unfairly.
abstract: Southern Methodist men's basketball coach Larry Brown criticizes his former employer, New York Knicks, for the way he contends they have treated current coach Mike Woodson, saying he has been left out on a limb; Woodson is expected to be let go by the Knicks at the end of the season.
lead_paragraph: Brown, who led the Knicks to a 23-59 record in 2005-6, said, among other things, that his former employer was treating the current coach, Mike Woodson, unfairly.

headline.main: Larry Brown, Ex-Coach of Knicks, Criticizes Franchise
